tasks.task: Pruning an apple tree in late March/early spring
subtasks: Gather pruning tools (pruners, big lopper, Swedish saw)
Identify branches to remove for opening up the canopy
Cut branches using proper technique (close to branch collar)
Remove high-growing branches to reduce need for ladders
Thin out inward-growing branches for better air circulation
Avoid exceeding 25% branch removal in one year
Promote lateral branches instead of vertical growth
Remove competing branches to maintain tree structure
Demonstrate proper pruning cuts (clean, no digging into branch)
Explain importance of open canopy for disease prevention
Address fire blight and other disease concerns
Improve airflow to reduce disease potential
